I’m going to continue to fight for what the American people want, and that’s the comprehensive coverage of the #ACA. The House has already passed legislation to do away with these flimsy and deceptive plans. Now the Senate must step up to do the same. #NoJunkPlans

Junk plans may seem like a great idea to consumers because they’re low cost, but they’re also low benefit. With junk plans, insurance companies can refuse to cover consumers’ pre-existing conditions and they may have annual or lifetime caps on coverage.

Today, I spoke out against the Trump Admin’s Executive Order to allow insurance companies to offer short-term, limited-duration plans that don’t have to cover essential health benefits like prescription drugs, emergency room visits and maternity care. #NoJunkPlans pic.twitter.com/b2apAwTotL
